intro: Cheiranthus elongatus, commonly known as the slender wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal areas and cliffs. Its elongated, hairy stems and bright yellow or orange flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species. Cheiranthus elongatus is also known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient plant in Mediterranean climates.
